messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Tangent - faith community
messages.msgSnippet: ... This made me laugh.  Being Unitarian, I wouldn t have worded the question any differently.  We always use the words faith community when asking or
messages.messageBody:
> Do you find you get much flack from your faith community?
> Alex>>>>>>>>>>
> ****Do you mean Church?

This made me laugh. Being Unitarian, I wouldn't have worded the
question any differently. We always use the words "faith community"
when asking or discussing religions, because it is so much more
universal. I never thought about someone not relating to the term
before.>>>>>>>>>>
****Well glad I gave you a chuckle<g> No I have never used the term "faith community" before.
Stephanie (not very universal <g>)




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Tangent - faith community
messages.msgSnippet: ... This made me laugh.  Being Unitarian, I wouldn t have worded the question any differently.  We always use the words faith community when asking or
messages.messageBody:
> Do you find you get much flack from your faith community?
> Alex>>>>>>>>>>
> ****Do you mean Church?

This made me laugh. Being Unitarian, I wouldn't have worded the
question any differently. We always use the words "faith community"
when asking or discussing religions, because it is so much more
universal. I never thought about someone not relating to the term
before.

Hmmm... just when you think you are being SO inclusive...

And, for the record, most of the UU homeschoolers I've met are
unschoolers as well (or at least VERY relaxed homeschoolers). Maybe
it's all the Uns we relate to. We could be Un Un Uns for short! :-)

BTW Holly, I thought that was a great article, too. You know, they
always have to counter EVERY homeschool article with some less than
enlightened school administrator - fortunately for the reporters, they
are very easy to find. <g>

Joni Zander
FotoCEO@...
